Class BinaryTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • BinaryTree<T>

  • public class BinaryTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of binary search tree. Note that this is not a height balancing tree so in worst case, height would be of O(n).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryTree()
      Creates a binary tree with root as null

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int height()
      Determine height of the tree

      Perform an inorder walk on the tree This also gives the key in the sorted order

      Function to insert a key into the binary tree at appropriate place
      java.util.ArrayList<T> postorderWalk()
      Perform a postorder walk on the tree
      java.util.ArrayList<T> preorderWalk()
      Perform a preorder walk on the tree
      void remove(T e)
      Deletes a given key from the binary tree
      boolean search(T e)
      Search for a given key in the binary tree
      java.lang.String toString()
      Pretty print the tree Tree printed is rotated by 90 degrees anti-clockwise

      • search

        public boolean search(T e)
        Search for a given key in the binary tree
        Parameters:
        e - Value to be searched for
        Returns:
        true if value is in the tree, false otherwise

      • remove

        public void remove(T e)
        Deletes a given key from the binary tree
        Parameters:
        e - key to be deleted from the tree
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the given key is not present in the tree

      • inorderWalk

        public java.util.ArrayList<T> inorderWalk()
        Perform an inorder walk on the tree This also gives the key in the sorted order
        Returns:
        an arraylist of elements in the order visited

      • preorderWalk

        Returns:
        an arraylist of elements in the order visited

        Perform a postorder walk on the tree
        Returns:
        an arraylist of elements in the order visited

      • height

        public int height()
        Determine height of the tree
        Returns:
        height of tree, 0 if empty
